ComponentType.name: notes
ComponentType.description: Human readable notes on the Component

ComponentType.name: pointDiam
ComponentType.description: Base type for ComponentTypes which specify an ( _x, _y, _z ) coordinate along with a _diameter. Note: no dimension used in the attributes for these coordinates! These are assumed to have dimension micrometer (10^-6 m). This is due to micrometers being the default option for the majority of neuronal morphology formats, and dimensions are omitted here to facilitate reading and writing of morphologies in NeuroML.

Parameter.name: x
Parameter.description: x coordinate of point. Note: no dimension used, see note above!

Parameter.name: y
Parameter.description: y coordinate of point. Note: no dimension used, see note above!

Parameter.name: z
Parameter.description: z coordinate of point. Note: no dimension used, see note above!

Parameter.name: diameter
Parameter.description: Diameter at point. Note: no dimension used, see note above!

ComponentType.name: baseVoltageDepRate
ComponentType.description: Base ComponentType for voltage dependent rate. Produces a time varying rate _r which depends on _v.

ComponentType.name: baseVoltageConcDepRate
ComponentType.description: Base ComponentType for voltage and concentration dependent rate. Produces a time varying rate _r which depends on _v and _caConc.

ComponentType.name: baseHHRate
ComponentType.description: Base ComponentType for rate which follow one of the typical forms for rate equations in the standard HH formalism, using the parameters _rate, _midpoint and _scale

ComponentType.name: HHExpRate
ComponentType.description: Exponential form for rate equation (Q: Should these be renamed hhExpRate, etc?)

ComponentType.name: HHSigmoidRate
ComponentType.description: Sigmoidal form for rate equation

ComponentType.name: HHExpLinearRate
ComponentType.description: Exponential linear form for rate equation. Linear for large positive _v, exponentially decays for large negative _v.

ComponentType.name: baseVoltageDepVariable
ComponentType.description: Base ComponentType for voltage dependent variable _x, which depends on _v. Can be used for inf/steady state of rate variable.

ComponentType.name: baseVoltageConcDepVariable
ComponentType.description: Base ComponentType for voltage and calcium concentration dependent variable _x, which depends on _v and _caConc.

ComponentType.name: baseHHVariable
ComponentType.description: Base ComponentType for voltage dependent dimensionless variable which follow one of the typical forms for variable equations in the standard HH formalism, using the parameters _rate, _midpoint, _scale

ComponentType.name: HHExpVariable
ComponentType.description: Exponential form for variable equation

ComponentType.name: HHSigmoidVariable
ComponentType.description: Sigmoidal form for variable equation

ComponentType.name: HHExpLinearVariable
ComponentType.description: Exponential linear form for variable equation. Linear for large positive _v, exponentially decays for large negative _v.

ComponentType.name: baseVoltageDepTime
ComponentType.description: Base type for voltage dependent ComponentType producing value _t with dimension time (e.g. for time course of rate variable). Note: time course would not normally be fit to exp/sigmoid etc.

ComponentType.name: fixedTimeCourse
ComponentType.description: Time course of a fixed magnitude _tau which can be used for the time course in _gateHH_

ComponentType.name: baseQ10Settings
ComponentType.description: Base ComponentType for a scaling to apply to gating variable time course, usually temperature dependent

ComponentType.name: q10Fixed
ComponentType.description: A fixed value, _fixedQ10, for the scaling of the time course of the gating variable

ComponentType.name: q10ExpTemp
ComponentType.description: A value for the Q10 scaling which varies as a standard function of the difference between the current temperature, _temperature, and the temperature at which the gating variable equations were determined, _experimentalTemp

ComponentType.name: baseConductanceScaling
ComponentType.description: Base ComponentType for a scaling to apply to a gate's conductance, e.g. temperature dependent scaling

ComponentType.name: q10ConductanceScaling
ComponentType.description: A value for the conductance scaling which varies as a standard function of the difference between the current temperature, _temperature, and the temperature at which the conductance was originally determined, _experimentalTemp

ComponentType.name: baseGate
ComponentType.description: Base ComponentType for a voltage and/or concentration dependent gate

ComponentType.name: gateHH
ComponentType.description: Gate which follows the general Hodgkin Huxley formalism

ComponentType.name: baseIonChannel
ComponentType.description: Base for all ion channel ComponentTypes

ComponentType.name: ionChannel
ComponentType.description: Temporary ComponentTypes extending _baseIonChannel_. This is needed since many existing examples use the name ionChannel. Should be removed.

ComponentType.name: ionChannelPassive
ComponentType.description: Simple passive ion channel where the constant conductance through the channel is equal to _conductance

ComponentType.name: ionChannelHH
ComponentType.description: Ion channel according to the Hodgkin Huxley formalism, with a number of gates (of type _gateHH_)

ComponentType.name: basePointCurrent
ComponentType.description: Base type for all ComponentTypes which produce a current _i (with dimension current)

Exposure.name: i
Exposure.description: The total (time varying) current produced by this ComponentType

ComponentType.name: baseVoltageDepPointCurrent
ComponentType.description: Base type for all ComponentTypes which produce a current _i (with dimension current) and require a membrane potential _v exposed on the parent Component

Requirement.name: v
Requirement.description: The current may vary with the voltage exposed by the ComponentType on which this is placed

ComponentType.name: basePointCurrentDL
ComponentType.description: Base type for all ComponentTypes which produce a dimensionless current _I. There will eventually be dimensionless equivalents of all the core current producing ComponentTypes such as _pulseGenerator_, _sineGenerator_ and _rampGenerator_

Exposure.name: I
Exposure.description: The total (time varying) current produced by this ComponentType

ComponentType.name: baseVoltageDepPointCurrentDL
ComponentType.description: Base type for all ComponentTypes which produce a dimensionless current _I and require a dimensionless membrane potential _V exposed on the parent Component

Requirement.name: V
Requirement.description: The current may vary with the voltage exposed by the ComponentType on which this is placed

ComponentType.name: pulseGenerator
ComponentType.description: Generates a constant current pulse of a certain _amplitude for a specified _duration after a _delay

Parameter.name: delay
Parameter.description: Delay before change in current. Current is zero prior to this.

Parameter.name: duration
Parameter.description: Duration for holding current at amplitude. Current is zero after delay + duration.

Parameter.name: amplitude
Parameter.description: Amplitude of current pulse

EventPort.name: in
EventPort.description: Note this is not used here. Will be removed in future

ComponentType.name: pulseGeneratorDL
ComponentType.description: Dimensionless equivalent of _pulseGenerator_. Generates a constant current pulse of a certain _amplitude for a specified _duration after a _delay

Parameter.name: delay
Parameter.description: Delay before change in current. Current is zero prior to this.

Parameter.name: duration
Parameter.description: Duration for holding current at amplitude. Current is zero after delay + duration.

Parameter.name: amplitude
Parameter.description: Amplitude of current pulse

EventPort.name: in
EventPort.description: Note this is not used here. Will be removed in future

ComponentType.name: sineGenerator
ComponentType.description: Generates a sinusoidally varying current after a time _delay, for a fixed _duration. The _period and maximum _amplitude of the current can be set as well as the _phase at which to start.

ComponentType.name: rampGenerator
ComponentType.description: Generates a ramping current after a time _delay, for a fixed _duration. During this time the current steadily changes from _startAmplitude to _finishAmplitude.

ComponentType.name: rampGeneratorDL
ComponentType.description: Generates a ramping current after a time _delay, for a fixed _duration. During this time the dimensionless current steadily changes from _startAmplitude to _finishAmplitude.

ComponentType.name: voltageClamp
ComponentType.description: Voltage clamp. Applies a variable current _i to try to keep parent at _targetVoltage. Not yet fully tested!!!

Parameter.name: delay
Parameter.description: Delay before change in current. Current is zero prior to this.

Parameter.name: duration
Parameter.description: Duration for attempting to keep parent at targetVoltage. Current is zero after delay + duration.

Parameter.name: targetVoltage
Parameter.description: Current will be applied to try to get parent to this target voltage

Parameter.name: seriesResistance
Parameter.description: Current will be calculated by the difference in voltage between the target and parent, divided by this value

EventPort.name: in
EventPort.description: Note this is not used here. Will be removed in future

ComponentType.name: baseSynapse
ComponentType.description: Base type for all synapses, i.e. ComponentTypes which produce a current (dimension current) and change Dynamics in response to an incoming event. cno_0000009

ComponentType.name: baseSynapseDL
ComponentType.description: Base type for all synapses, i.e. ComponentTypes which produce a dimensionless current and change Dynamics in response to an incoming event. cno_0000009

ComponentType.name: baseConductanceBasedSynapse
ComponentType.description: Synapse model which exposes a conductance _g in addition to producing a current. Not necessarily ohmic!! cno_0000027

Parameter.name: gbase
Parameter.description: Baseline conductance, generally the maximum conductance following a single spike

Parameter.name: erev
Parameter.description: Reversal potential of the synapse

Exposure.name: g
Exposure.description: Time varying conductance through the synapse

ComponentType.name: expOneSynapse
ComponentType.description: Ohmic synapse model whose conductance rises instantaneously by _gbase on receiving an event, and which decays exponentially to zero with time course _tauDecay

Parameter.name: tauDecay
Parameter.description: Time course of decay

ComponentType.name: expTwoSynapse
ComponentType.description: Ohmic synapse model whose conductance waveform on receiving an event has a rise time of _tauRise and a decay time of _tauDecay. Max conductance reached during this time (assuming zero conductance before) is _gbase.

ComponentType.name: baseBlock
ComponentType.description: Base of any ComponentType which produces a varying scaling (or blockage) of synaptic strength of magnitude _scaling

ComponentType.name: voltageConcDepBlock
ComponentType.description: Synaptic blocking mechanism which varys with membrane potential across the synapse, e.g. in NMDA receptor mediated synapses

ComponentType.name: nmdaSynapse
ComponentType.description: NMDA receptor mediated synapse, whose conductance is scaled by a factor dependent on the concentration of magnesium (assumed fixed) and membrane potential

ComponentType.name: stpMechanism
ComponentType.description: ComponentType for model of short term plasticity. Used in _stpSynapse_. Note, need to enable passing of spike events to child elements so that stpMechanism can contain the state variables _R, _U, etc. and update them appropriately. cno_0000182

ComponentType.name: stpSynapse
ComponentType.description: Short term plasticity model based on Tsodyks, M., Uziel, A., and Markram, H. (2000). Synchrony generation in recurrent networks with frequency-dependent synapses. J Neurosci 20, RC50. and Tsodyks, M.V., and Markram, H. (1997). The neural code between neocortical pyramidal neurons depends on neurotransmitter release probability. Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A 94, 719-723. cno_0000188

StateAssignment.value: U * exp(-(tsince) / tauFac) + initReleaseProb * (1 - (U * exp(-(tsince) / tauFac)))

ComponentType.name: stdpSynapse
ComponentType.description: Spike timing dependent plasticity mechanism, NOTE: EXAMPLE NOT YET WORKING!!!! cno_0000034

ComponentType.name: baseCell
ComponentType.description: Base type of any cell which can be used in a population

ComponentType.name: baseCellMembPot
ComponentType.description: Any cell which has a membrane potential _v with voltage units. These will emit _spike events.

ComponentType.name: baseCellMembPotDL
ComponentType.description: Any cell which has a dimensioness membrane potential, _V. These will emit _spike events.

ComponentType.name: baseChannelPopulation
ComponentType.description: Base type for any current produced by a population of channels, all of type _ionChannel

ComponentType.name: channelPopulation
ComponentType.description: Population of _number ohmic ion channels. These each produce a conductance _channelg across a reversal potential _erev, giving a total current _i.

ComponentType.name: channelPopulationNernst
ComponentType.description: Population of channels with a time varying reversal potential _erev determined by Nernst equation. Hard coded for Ca only! Work in progress!!

Constant.name: R
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

Constant.name: zCa
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

Constant.name: F
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

ComponentType.name: baseChannelDensity
ComponentType.description: Base type for current distributed on an area of a cell

ComponentType.name: baseChannelDensityCond
ComponentType.description: Base type for distributed conductances on an area of a cell producing a (not necessarily ohmic) current

ComponentType.name: channelDensity
ComponentType.description: Specifies a time varying ohmic conductance density, _gDensity, which is distributed on an area of the cell with fixed reversal potential _erev producing a current density _iDensity

ComponentType.name: channelDensityNernst
ComponentType.description: Specifies a time varying conductance density, _gDensity, which is distributed on an area of the cell, producing a current density _iDensity and whose reversal potential is calculated from the Nernst equation. Hard coded for Ca only! Work in progress!!

Constant.name: R
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

Constant.name: zCa
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

Constant.name: F
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

ComponentType.name: channelDensityGHK
ComponentType.description: Specifies a time varying conductance density, _gDensity, which is distributed on an area of the cell, producing a current density _iDensity and whose reversal potential is calculated from the Goldman Hodgkin Katz equation. Hard coded for Ca only! Work in progress!

Constant.name: R
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

Constant.name: zCa
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

Constant.name: F
Constant.description: TODO: Make this a global constant!

DerivedVariable.name: iDensity
DerivedVariable.value: -1 * channelf * permeability * zCa * F * K * v * ( caConc - (caConcExt * expKv) ) / (1 - expKv)

ComponentType.name: pointCellCondBased
ComponentType.description: Simple model of a conductance based cell, with no separate morphology element, just an absolute capacitance _C, and a set of channel populations

ComponentType.name: pointCellCondBasedCa
ComponentType.description: TEMPORARY: Point cell with conductances and Ca concentration info. Not yet fully tested!!!

ComponentType.name: distal
ComponentType.description: Point furthest from the soma in a segment

ComponentType.name: proximal
ComponentType.description: Point closest to the soma in a segment. Note, if the proximal point is equal to the distal point of the parent segment, proximal can be omitted.

ComponentType.name: parent
ComponentType.description: Specifies the segment which is this segment's parent

ComponentType.name: segment
ComponentType.description: A segment defines the smallest unit within a possibly branching structure (_morphology_), such as a dendrite or axon. The shape is given by the _proximal_ and _distal_ points. If _proximal_ is missing, the proximal point is assumed to be the _distal_ point of the parent. _parent_ specifies the parent segment. The first segment (no _parent_) usually represents the soma. NOTE: LEMS does not yet support multicompartmental modelling, so the Dynamics here is only appropriate for single compartment modelling.

DerivedVariable.name: length
DerivedVariable.value: sqrt(((dx - px) * (dx - px) + (dy - py) * (dy - py) + (dz - pz) * (dz - pz))/(LEN * LEN)) * LEN

ComponentType.name: segmentGroup
ComponentType.description: A method to describe a group of _segment_s in a _morphology_

ComponentType.name: member
ComponentType.description: A single identified _segment_ which is part of the _segmentGroup_

ComponentType.name: from
ComponentType.description: Specifies which _segment_ distal from which to calculate the _segmentGroup_

ComponentType.name: to
ComponentType.description: Specifies which _segment_ up to which to calculate the _segmentGroup_

ComponentType.name: include
ComponentType.description: Include all members of another _segmentGroup_ in this

ComponentType.name: path
ComponentType.description: Include all the segments between those specified by _from_ and _to_, inclusive

ComponentType.name: subTree
ComponentType.description: Include all the segments distal to that specified by _from_ in the _segmentGroup_

ComponentType.name: morphology
ComponentType.description: The collection of _segment_s which specify the 3D structure of the cell, along with a number of _segmentGroup_s

ComponentType.name: specificCapacitance
ComponentType.description: Capacitance per unit area

ComponentType.name: initMembPotential
ComponentType.description: Explicitly set initial membrane potential for the cell

ComponentType.name: spikeThresh
ComponentType.description: Membrane potential at which to emit a spiking event. Note, usually the spiking event will not be emitted again until the membrane potential has fallen below this value and rises again to cross it in a positive direction

ComponentType.name: membraneProperties
ComponentType.description: Properties specific to the membrane, such as the _populations of channels, _channelDensities, _specificCapacitance, etc.

ComponentType.name: biophysicalProperties
ComponentType.description: The biophysical properties of the _cell_, including the _membraneProperties_ and the _intracellularProperties_

ComponentType.name: intracellularProperties
ComponentType.description: Biophysical properties related to the intracellular space within the _cell_, such as the _resistivity_ and the list of _species_ present. _caConc and _caConcExt are explicitly exposed here to facilitate accessing these values from other Components, even though _caConcExt is clearly not an intracellular property

ComponentType.name: resistivity
ComponentType.description: The resistivity, or specific axial resistance, of the cytoplasm

ComponentType.name: concentrationModel
ComponentType.description: Base for any model of an ion concentration which changes with time. Internal, _concentration, and external, _extConcentration, values for the concentration of the ion (specified by _species) are given.

ComponentType.name: decayingPoolConcentrationModel
ComponentType.description: Model of buffering of concentration of an ion (currently hard coded to be calcium, due to requirement for _iCa) which has a baseline level _restingConc and tends to this value with time course _decayConstant. The ion is assumed to occupy a shell inside the membrane of thickness _shellThickness.

ComponentType.name: species
ComponentType.description: Description of a chemical species identified by _ion, which has internal, _concentration, and external, _extConcentration values for its concentration

ComponentType.name: cell
ComponentType.description: Cell with _segment_s specified in a _morphology_ element along with details on its _biophysicalProperties_. NOTE: this can only be correctly simulated using LEMS when there is a single segment in the cell, and _v of this cell represents the membrane potential in that isopotential segment!!!

ComponentType.name: baseCellMembPotCap
ComponentType.description: Any cell with a membrane potential _v with voltage units and a membrane capacitance _C. Also defines exposed value _iSyn for current due to external synapses and _iMemb for total current crossing membrane (normally channel currents plus _iSyn)

Parameter.name: C
Parameter.description: Total capacitance of the cell membrane

Exposure.name: iSyn
Exposure.description: Total current due to synaptic inputs

Exposure.name: iMemb
Exposure.description: Total current crossing the cell membrane

ComponentType.name: baseIaf
ComponentType.description: Base ComponentType for an integrate and fire cell which emits a spiking event at membrane potential _thresh and and resets to _reset

Parameter.name: thresh
Parameter.description: The membrane potential at which to emit a spiking event and reset voltage

Parameter.name: reset
Parameter.description: The value the membrane potential is reset to on spiking

ComponentType.name: iafTauCell
ComponentType.description: Integrate and fire cell which returns to its leak reversal potential of _leakReversal with a time course _tau

ComponentType.name: iafTauRefCell
ComponentType.description: Integrate and fire cell which returns to its leak reversal potential of _leakReversal with a time course _tau. It has a refractory period of _refract after spiking

ComponentType.name: baseIafCapCell
ComponentType.description: Base Type for all Integrate and Fire cells with a capacitance _C, threshold _thresh and reset membrane potential _reset

ComponentType.name: iafCell
ComponentType.description: Integrate and fire cell with capacitance _C, _leakConductance and _leakReversal

ComponentType.name: izhikevichCell
ComponentType.description: Cell based on the model of Izhikevich, see http://izhikevich.org/publications/spikes.htm

TimeDerivative.value: (0.04 * v^2 / MVOLT + 5 * v + (140.0 - U + I + ISyn) * MVOLT)/MSEC

ComponentType.name: adExIaFCell
ComponentType.description: Model based on Brette R and Gerstner W (2005) Adaptive Exponential Integrate-and-Fire Model as an Effective Description of Neuronal Activity. J Neurophysiol 94:3637-3642

DerivedVariable.name: iMemb
DerivedVariable.value: -1 * gL * (v - EL) + gL * delT * exp((v - VT) / delT) - w + I + iSyn

ComponentType.name: fitzHughNagumoCell
ComponentType.description: Simple dimensionless model of spiking cell from FitzHugh and Nagumo. Based on http://www.scholarpedia.org/article/FitzHugh-Nagumo_model

ComponentType.name: network
ComponentType.description: Network containing _population_s, _projection_s and lists of _explicitConnection_s (either directly between components of the populations or via synapses)

Exposure.name: temperature
Exposure.description: Temperature will be taken from extracellularProperties child

ComponentType.name: extracellularProperties
ComponentType.description: A ComponentType holding information about the environment outside specific cells, e.g. the ambient temperature

ComponentType.name: basePopulation
ComponentType.description: A population of cells (anything which extends _baseCell_)

Requirement.name: temperature
Requirement.description: Normally comes from the extracellularProperties in the network

ComponentType.name: population
ComponentType.description: A population of components, with just one parameter for the _size

Parameter.name: size
Parameter.description: Number of instances of this Component to create when the population is instantiated

ComponentType.name: populationList
ComponentType.description: An explicit list of the cells in the population. Not yet stable...

ComponentType.name: region
ComponentType.description: Initial attempt to specify 3D region for placing cells. Work in progress...

ComponentType.name: rectangularExtent
ComponentType.description: For defining a 3D rectangular box

ComponentType.name: networkElementInstance
ComponentType.description: Initial attempt to specify instances in populations. Work in progress...

ComponentType.name: networkElementInstance1D
ComponentType.description: Initial attempt to specify instances in 1D populations. Work in progress...

ComponentType.name: projection
ComponentType.description: Projection from one population to another. Currently it's better to define an explicit list of connections, using _explicitConnection_. Work in progress...

ComponentType.name: explicitConnection
ComponentType.description: Explicit event connection between components

ComponentType.name: connection
ComponentType.description: Explicit event connection directly between named components

ComponentType.name: synapticConnection
ComponentType.description: Explicit event connection between named components, which gets processed via a new instance of a _synapse component which is created on the target component

ComponentType.name: explicitInput
ComponentType.description: An explicit input (anything which extends _basePointCurrent_) to a target cell in a population
